page.title: 17ECOLOGY.
page.content: The are seven main points on our coast I think that Ilfracombe has a very extraordinary coast.Mostly it is steep cliff and the land stucture is made up of slate and sandstone.Capstone holds the British flag, many people say that Capstone was once an island long ago. Flat point and Brandy Cove are both a part of the National Trust. Ilfracombe's water supply comes from Slade reservoir which is a mile away from our area.A lot of chlorine is used to purify the water.Ilfracombe being in a southern area has not got much flouride in the water.The National Trust is a protection against animals and woodland.The land is kept to its natural resources and most of them are open to the public(e.g Brandy Cove area).Capstone and Hillsborough both have rabbits, foxes and voles.The areas both are bracken and heath.
